intro: Cathedra inaequilatera, commonly known as the unequal-sided chair plant, is a unique species of flowering plant belonging to the family Gesneriaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, asymmetrical leaves that give it its scientific name. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its unusual morphology, it is a popular choice for collectors and botanists interested in rare and unusual plant species.
